The sound track workaround (setting to the Stereo tracks) doesn't work. I feed the audio to the Media Centre over S/P-dif, so I cannot use any other setting than A52 over S/P-dif.

I do appreciate that someone is making the effort to record, convert and upload this for other users, but all they need to do is to set the audio to a fixed level.
Thanks again, EZTV!

The people whining about the audio are correct; there is dynamic range compression being applied to the source material, which absolutely ruins quiet scenes.

With regards to the video, it is important to note that it was a conscious decision to shoot the series using 8mm film cameras, which have a significant amount of grain. Under high compression such as these 1GB episode releases, the subtle flickering grain effect is compressed into a a distracting pool of artifacts. The only way to solve this is to lower the compression, which is why I'm going to wait until someone can do a responsible Blu-ray rip at a much higher quality level to display the grain as it was intended to be viewed by the cinematographers.
